intro: Jacquinia curtissii, commonly known as the Texas bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers. Jacquinia curtissii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
